A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
the 8th film in the star wars saga simply doesn't live up to the hype built up by the (frankly mediocre) Force Awakens. Instead of simply retreading the earlier movies like JJ Abrams Force Awakens Rian tries to do something a little different and falls on his face. Literally zero explanation on how a terrorist organization managed to conquer an entire galaxy in a few hours. Sure they blew up a few planets but they no longer have their super weapon. Why would ever planet fall into line after that? Yet another rag tag group of rebels are on the run from the evil "not the empire" First Order. They are slowly running out of fuel in space. Rey has left to train with Luke and some Porgs on some island planet. Luke isn't in the mood and Rey has to wait around for him to help...though really this only takes about 18 hours in total\, so Luke comes around pretty quickly. Rey's mary-sue status is unchanged as she is automatically great at everything and even Ghost Yoda mentions she has nothing left to learn. 
In an unrelated Subplot Finn and Rose go to Space Vegas and look for a codebreaker\, id explain more of this plot but it goes no where and doesn't effect the rest the film.
The film was highly praised by critics who i assume have never seen another film but overly bashed by fans. To be honest its basically just as good as Force Awakens\, which is to say its "average". 
Every scene with Mark Hamil is great and he gives an amazing performance. Rey/Kylo bits are also very well handled.
It has a lot of filler and the run time is too bloated.
Maybe Disney should have planned on a trilogy instead of just winging it\, Letting JJ do "star wars greatest hits" was annoying but a reason relaunch for the series but then Rian just gives JJ a huge middle finger and just messes up everything he set up (which wasn't great in the first place)
